item.title: 联合利华冰淇淋分拆交易首次亮相面临停产延期
item.description: 联合利华公司（Unilever Plc）剥离的冰淇淋部门将比原计划晚近一个月开始交易，此前美国政府停摆导致上市被推迟。【原文：Unilever Plc’s spinoff of its ice cream unit will start trading nearly a month later than planned, after the listing was delayed by the US government shutdown.】

item.title: 量化基金利用 ESG 信号挑选澳大利亚股票赢家
item.description: 一家专注于澳大利亚股票的量化基金正在击败市场，因为该基金认为，具有更高环境、社会和公司治理资质的公司也更高效、更有利可图。【原文：A quantitative fund focused on Australian equities is beating the market by betting that companies with higher ESG credentials are also more efficient and profitable.】

item.title: IBM 将裁员数千人，专注软件业务增长
item.description: 国际商业机器公司（International Business Machines Corp. ）本季度将裁员数千人，同时继续将业务重心转向高增长的软件和服务。【原文：International Business Machines Corp. will cut thousands of workers this quarter while it continues to shift the focus of its business to higher-growth software and services.】

item.title: 美国股指跌破历史纪录，国债上涨
item.description: 由于对股票估值的担忧加剧了股市的疲软，并使投资者转向政府债券，周二国债价格走高。【原文：Treasury prices edged higher on Tuesday as worries over equity valuations fueled weakness in stocks and sent investors into government bonds.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）延长与塞内加尔的融资谈判，推动新计划的实施
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）延长了与塞内加尔的会谈，双方正努力敲定新贷款计划的框架。【原文：The International Monetary Fund extended talks with Senegal as the two sides work to finalize the framework for a new lending program.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司浅水油田销售受阻
item.description: 巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）寻求剥离一些海上油田的控制权，此举将使巴西石油巨头免于承担拆除旧平台的高昂费用。【原文：Petrobras sought to divest control of some offshore oil fields in a move that would have shielded the Brazilian oil giant from hefty costs to dismantle old platforms.】

item.title: 亚马逊要求 "惑 "阻止人工智能代理购物
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）向 Perplexity AI 公司发出了一封终止信，要求这家人工智能搜索初创公司停止允许其人工智能浏览器代理 Comet 为用户进行在线购物。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. has sent a cease-and-desist letter to Perplexity AI Inc. demanding that the artificial intelligence search startup stop allowing its AI browser agent, Comet, to make purchases online for users.】

item.title: 经过两年代价高昂的战争，以色列希望控制财政赤字
item.description: 以色列财政部长 Bezalel Smotrich 表示，以色列执政联盟希望明年的预算能使国家 "从冲突走向增长"，并估计在与哈马斯实现停火后赤字将有所减少。【原文：Israel’s ruling coalition wants next year’s budget to take the country “from conflict to growth” and estimates the deficit will shrink now that a ceasefire with Hamas has been secured, Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said.】

item.title: 阿波罗的罗文瞄准以零售为重点的公司，支持私人资产增长
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.首席执行官马克-罗文（Marc Rowan）说。【原文：Asset managers that reach retail clients have become a new market for private investments, Apollo Global Management Inc. Chief Executive Officer Marc Rowan said.】

item.title: TikTok 因宣传自杀内容在法国受到调查
item.description: 法国正在对 TikTok 进行调查，原因是该公司未能审查中国视频共享平台上宣扬自杀的材料。【原文：TikTok is under investigation in France for failing to vet material that promotes suicide on the Chinese video-sharing platform.】

item.title: First Brands 德国分公司申请破产，痛苦蔓延
item.description: First Brands 集团的几家德国子公司已申请破产，这表明这家美国汽车零部件供应商 9 月份破产的影响正在波及其国外业务。【原文：Several German subsidiaries of First Brands Group have filed for insolvency, in a sign that the fallout from the US car parts supplier’s September bankruptcy is rippling through to its foreign operations.】

item.title: 苹果准备推出低价笔记本电脑，与 Chromebook 和 Windows PC 竞争
item.description: 苹果公司正准备首次进军低成本笔记本电脑市场，开发一款经济型 Mac，旨在吸引 Chromebook 和入门级 Windows PC 的客户。【原文：Apple Inc. is preparing to enter the low-cost laptop market for the first time, developing a budget Mac aimed at luring away customers from Chromebooks and entry-level Windows PCs.】

item.title: 阿布扎比加入阿根廷推动液化天然气发展的行列，YPF 公司对 Milei 议程表示欢迎
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊赢得选民授权，继续推进他的自由主义实验，他正在起草全面的税收和劳动改革方案。【原文：State-run YPF SA said the oil and gas industry would benefit from sweeping tax and labor reforms that Argentine President Javier Milei is drafting after he won a mandate from voters to press ahead with his libertarian experiment.】

item.title: 在人工智能消费狂潮中，微软新云交易额突破 600 亿美元
item.description: 微软公司已承诺向新云数据中心公司投入 600 多亿美元，这表明该公司正在努力寻找足够的计算能力来满足其人工智能需求。【原文：Microsoft Corp. has committed more than $60 billion to neocloud data center companies, evidence of the company’s race to find enough computing capacity for its AI needs.】

item.title: 瑞银在资本辩论中获得瑞士立法者的支持
item.description: 瑞士立法者批评了政府关于影响瑞银集团的部分新资本规则的提案，这是议会扩大支持对该国最大银行采取更温和立场的一个早期信号。【原文：Swiss lawmakers criticized a government proposal on parts of new capital rules affecting UBS Group AG, in an early signal of broadening support in parliament for a softer stance on the country’s largest bank.】

item.title: 巴西上调 2025-26 年原糖产量预测，原糖价格下跌
item.description: 由于巴西政府预测机构Conab将2025-26年糖产量预测上调至4500万吨，比之前的预估上调1.3%，原糖期货下跌多达3.6%，至每磅14.13美分。糖价仍接近 2020 年的水平。【原文：Raw sugar futures dropped as much as 3.6% to 14.13 cents a pound as Brazil’s government forecasting agency, Conab, raised its 2025-26 sugar output forecast to 45 million metric tons, up 1.3% from a prior estimate. Prices remain near levels last seen in 2020.】

item.title: 中国 MMG 因 5 亿美元盎格鲁交易遭欧盟调查
item.description: 中资矿业公司MMG Ltd.斥资5亿美元收购英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc）巴西镍矿业务的交易遭到了欧盟的深入调查，因为监管机构警告称，该交易威胁到了欧盟的不锈钢行业。【原文：Chinese-owned mining firm MMG Ltd.’s $500 million purchase of Anglo American Plc’s Brazilian nickel business has been hit by an in-depth European Union probe after regulators warned that the deal threatens the bloc’s stainless-steel industry.】

item.title: 玉米和大豆低迷，美国数据空白令出口需求蒙上阴影
item.description: 芝加哥玉米和大豆下跌，而小麦则抹去了早些时候的涨幅，原因是美国政府停摆使交易商对任何出口到中国或其他国家的销售情况一无所知。【原文：Corn and soybeans fell while wheat erased earlier gains in Chicago as the US government shutdown kept traders in the dark about any export sales to China or other countries.】

item.title: 美国钢铁公司称日本所有权将释放 30 亿美元价值
item.description: 美国钢铁公司认为，由于新的日本所有权，新日本制铁公司（Nippon Steel Corp.【原文：United States Steel Corp. sees the potential to unlock $3 billion in value thanks to its new Japanese ownership, with added earnings from Nippon Steel Corp.’s investments in new projects along with operational efficiencies.】

item.title: 美联储投资组合中枢出台前货币市场压力犹存
item.description: 据华尔街分析师称，由于融资成本居高不下，货币市场的压力可能会持续到 11 月份，从而给美联储带来压力，迫使其在下个月停止缩减投资组合之前就增强流动性。【原文：Strains in money markets could persist into November as funding costs remain stubbornly high, building pressure for the Federal Reserve to bolster liquidity even before it stops shrinking its portfolio next month, according to Wall Street analysts.】

item.title: 与俄罗斯的历史渊源帮助贡渥集团赢得制裁大奖
item.description: 托尔比约恩-托恩奎斯特一生中最大的两笔交易都是因为美国的制裁。【原文：The two biggest deals of Torbjörn Törnqvist’s life have happened because of US sanctions.】

item.title: 人工智能蓬勃发展，清洁能源动荡不安，美国公用事业游说激增 14
item.description: 非营利组织 OpenSecrets 的最新数据显示，美国公用事业公司今年的游说费用有望达到 1.5 亿美元，达到十多年来的最高水平。【原文：US utilities are on track to spend $150 million on lobbying this year, reaching the highest level in more than a decade, according to fresh data from nonprofit OpenSecrets.】

item.title: 新任 Stegra 主席认为本轮融资将持续到 2026 年
item.description: Stegra AB 公司的新任主席 Shaun Kingsbury 表示，目前的资本募集可能会在第一季度完成，因为这家瑞典绿色钢材初创公司正在努力争取新的资金，以支付不断膨胀的建设成本。【原文：Stegra AB’s new Chairman Shaun Kingsbury said the current capital raise likely will be completed in the first quarter as the Swedish green-steel startup races to secure fresh funding to cover ballooning construction costs.】

item.title: 卡特彼勒因能源和设备需求上调盈利目标
item.description: 卡特彼勒公司（Caterpillar Inc.【原文：Caterpillar Inc. hiked its goals for revenue and profit margins as the company looks to capitalize on rising demand for heavy machinery and energy.】

item.title: 数据中心狂潮引发行业调查的困境警告
item.description: 据一项行业调查显示，投资者正大举举债，为为人工智能基础设施提供支持的数据中心提供资金，但由于缺乏对计算能力长期需求的了解，一些参与者将面临困境。【原文：Investors are piling into massive debt packages to fund the data centers that feed the artificial intelligence infrastructure, but a lack of visibility around long-term demand for computational power points to distress ahead for some players, according to an industry survey.】

item.title: WhatsApp 推出苹果手表应用程序，提供语音信息和其他功能
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司旗下的流行信息服务 WhatsApp 推出了一款独立的 Apple Watch 应用程序，使用户可以更方便地通过苹果公司的智能手表与他们的聊天内容进行互动，而无需拿出 iPhone。【原文：WhatsApp, the popular messaging service owned by Meta Platforms Inc., introduced a standalone Apple Watch app that makes it easier for users to interact with their chats from Apple Inc.’s smartwatch without pulling out an iPhone.】

item.title: 经济负担能力问题使美国首次购房者年龄中位数升至 40 岁
item.description: 美国首次购房者的年龄中位数已攀升至创纪录的 40 岁，因为过去几年房价和抵押贷款利率的飙升推迟了数百万美国人拥有住房的时间。【原文：The median age of first-time homebuyers in the US has climbed to a record of 40 as soaring prices and mortgage rates over the last few years delay homeownership for millions of Americans.】

item.title: 尼日利亚摆脱特朗普威胁继续实施欧洲债券计划
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁对尼日利亚境内的伊斯兰激进分子采取军事行动并引发股市大跌几天后，尼日利亚正计划最快于本周出售 23 亿美元的欧元债券，以测试投资者对这种债务的胃口。【原文：Nigeria is planning to sell $2.3 billion in eurobonds as soon as this week, testing investor appetite for the debt days after US President Donald Trump threatened military action against Islamist militants in the country and sparked a selloff.】

item.title: Palantir 盈利引发估值担忧，美股下跌
item.description: 由于 Palantir Technologies Inc. 的财报引发了人工智能公司的抛售，而且华尔街首席执行官们警告称股市将出现回调，周二美国股市暴跌。【原文：US stocks tumbled on Tuesday as earnings from Palantir Technologies Inc. triggered a selloff among artificial intelligence names and Wall Street chief executives warned that the equity market was due for a pullback.】
